query:
98. In the recent years Chad, Guinea, Mali
and Sudan caught the international
attention for which one of the following
reasons common to all of them?
(a) Discovery of rich deposits of rare
earth elements
(b) Establishment of Chinese military
bases
(c) Southward expansion of Sahara
Desert
(d) Successful coups

solution_notes.summary: The question asks for a common reason why Chad, Guinea, Mali, and Sudan have recently caught international attention. Based on the provided information, all four countries have experienced successful coups or significant political instability involving military takeovers.
answer_options_provided: (a) Discovery of rich deposits of rare earth elements

sections.title: Overview of Political Instability in Chad, Guinea, Mali, and Sudan

content.text: In recent years, Chad, Guinea, Mali, and Sudan have all experienced significant political instability, often involving military coups or attempted coups.
This common thread of political upheaval distinguishes them in international news and discussions.

sections.slide_layout: Title slide with a brief overview of the political situations in the four countries.

assessment_questions.concept_to_be_assessed: Understanding the recent history of political instability in African nations.

sections.title: Chad: Political Developments

content.text: In April 2021, Chad's President Idriss Déby died, and his son Mahamat Idriss Déby took over as interim president leading the Transitional Military Council (TMC).
The TMC promised elections, but political tensions remain high, indicating potential instability.

sections.slide_layout: Bullet points detailing the key events in Chad's recent political history.

assessment_questions.concept_to_be_assessed: Knowledge of the political transition in Chad following President Déby's death.

sections.title: Guinea: Military Coup

content.text: In September 2021, a military coup in Guinea ousted President Alpha Condé.
Colonel Mamady Doumbouya declared himself the interim president, leading to international condemnation and uncertainty.

sections.slide_layout: A timeline of the coup events in Guinea with key figures highlighted.

assessment_questions.concept_to_be_assessed: Understanding the causes and consequences of the military coup in Guinea.

sections.title: Mali: Multiple Military Coups

content.text: Mali experienced two military coups in a short period, August 2020 and May 2021.
Colonel Assimi Goïta, leader of both coups, is currently the interim president, causing significant international concern.

sections.slide_layout: A comparison of the two coups in Mali and their impact on the country's stability.

assessment_questions.concept_to_be_assessed: Knowledge of the political events in Mali, including the military coups and their leaders.

sections.title: Sudan: Political Transition and Coup

content.text: Sudan has been undergoing a political transition since the ousting of President Omar al-Bashir in 2019.
In October 2021, a military coup disrupted the transition, with General Abdel Fattah al-Burhan dissolving the government, leading to widespread protests and international condemnation.

sections.slide_layout: A flowchart illustrating the political transition in Sudan and the events leading to the 2021 coup.

assessment_questions.concept_to_be_assessed: Understanding the complexities of the political transition in Sudan and the impact of the military coup.

correct_answer_descriptions: Chad, Guinea, Mali, and Sudan have all experienced coups or significant political instability involving military takeovers in recent years, making this the common reason for their international attention.

accuracy_proof: Chad's TMC takeover after President Déby's death
Guinea's military coup led by Colonel Mamady Doumbouya
Mali's multiple coups led by Colonel Assimi Goïta
Sudan's disrupted political transition and the 2021 military coup
missing_content: Detailed analysis of the socio-economic factors contributing to these coups.
